deck.name: A1 – Essential Vocabulary
deck.description: Beginner: basic words for everyday situations — greetings, numbers, family, food, and common objects.

cards.definition: used to make a polite request
cards.context: Can I have some water, please?
Sorry, I did not hear you.
Yes, I would like some tea.
No, I do not want any coffee.

cards.definition: used to get attention or apologize
cards.context: Excuse me, where is the station?

cards.definition: a greeting used in the morning
cards.context: Good morning, did you sleep well?

cards.definition: a greeting for someone who arrives
an informal way to say goodbye
refers to the person spoken to
refers to a thing or animal
refers to the speaker and others
cards.context: We are going to the park.

cards.definition: refers to other people or things

cards.context: My father works in an office.
My brother is older than me.
Their son is three years old.
His wife works at a hospital.
The child is playing in the garden.
Every parent wants the best for their child.

cards.definition: a person you like and trust

cards.context: The boy is riding his bicycle.
The girl is drawing a picture.
The man is reading a newspaper.
The woman is talking on the phone.
Many people live in this city.
There are three apples on the table.
We have four chairs in the kitchen.
The class starts in five minutes.
There are six eggs in the box.
There are seven days in a week.
I wake up at eight o\
I count from one to ten.
There are twenty students in the class.
The book has one hundred pages.
This is my first day at school.

cards.definition: the color of blood or fire
cards.context: She is wearing a red dress.
The trees are green in summer.
He is wearing a black jacket.

cards.definition: a color between red and yellow

cards.context: Can I have a glass of water?
The food in this restaurant is good.

cards.definition: a basic baked food made from flour
cards.context: I buy fresh bread every morning.

cards.definition: a food laid by a chicken
cards.context: I eat an egg for breakfast.

cards.definition: small white or brown grains used as food
a common bird used for food
cards.context: We are having chicken for dinner.

cards.definition: an animal that lives in water, also a food
cards.context: I like to eat fish on Friday.

cards.definition: sweet food from plants, like apples
cards.context: Fruit is good for your health.

cards.definition: a round red or green fruit
cards.context: She eats an apple every day.

cards.definition: a plant or part of a plant used as food
a round vegetable that grows underground
a soft red fruit used in salads and cooking
cards.context: I put tomato in my salad.

cards.definition: a solid food made from milk
cards.context: I like cheese on my sandwich.
Do you take sugar in your tea?

cards.definition: a white substance used to add flavor
cards.context: Can you pass me the salt?
I drink coffee in the morning.

cards.definition: a hot drink made with leaves and water
cards.context: Would you like a cup of tea?
I drink orange juice for breakfast.
I eat soup when I am cold.

cards.definition: bread with food between two slices
cards.context: I had a sandwich for lunch.

cards.definition: the first meal of the day
a meal eaten in the middle of the day
the physical form of a person
cards.context: Exercise is good for your body.

cards.definition: the top part of the body
cards.context: He put a hat on his head.

cards.definition: the part at the end of your arm
cards.context: She held the cup in her hand.

cards.definition: the part of the body used for seeing
the part of the face used for eating and speaking
cards.context: Open your mouth and say ah.

cards.definition: the part of the body used for hearing
cards.context: He has an earache in his left ear.

cards.definition: the part of the face used for smelling
cards.context: The dog has a cold nose.

cards.definition: the thin strands growing on your head
the bottom part of your leg
cards.context: I hurt my foot playing football.

cards.definition: the long part of the body used for walking
the part of the body between shoulder and hand
cards.context: She carried the baby in her arms.

cards.definition: the front part of the head
cards.context: Wash your face with warm water.
Your heart beats faster when you run.

cards.definition: the rear part of the body
cards.context: My back hurts after sitting all day.

cards.definition: a part of a building with walls
a flat surface that opens and closes an entrance
an opening with glass in a wall
cards.context: Open the window for fresh air.

cards.definition: a flat surface with legs for placing things
cards.context: The book is on the table.

cards.definition: a piece of furniture for sitting

cards.context: She goes to bed at ten.
He is cooking in the kitchen.

cards.definition: a room with a toilet and shower
an area of land with plants or flowers
cards.context: We have flowers in the garden.

cards.definition: a metal object used to lock or unlock
a device used to make calls

cards.context: She put the book in her bag.
I am reading a good book.

cards.definition: a tool used for writing with ink

cards.context: I need a piece of paper.
There is a picture on the wall.

cards.definition: a device that shows the time
cards.context: The clock on the wall says three.
She drank a cup of tea.

cards.definition: a container for drinking, usually transparent
a container with a narrow neck
cards.context: I bought a bottle of water.

cards.definition: coins and notes used to buy things
cards.context: I do not have enough money.

cards.definition: a large vehicle for many passengers
cards.context: I take the bus to work.

cards.definition: a vehicle that runs on rails

cards.context: The children go to school at eight.

cards.definition: a place where you buy things
cards.context: The shop is open from nine to five.

cards.definition: a place where sick people are treated
a place where buses or trains stop
cards.context: The station is near the park.

cards.definition: a place where you eat meals
cards.context: We went to a nice restaurant.
The hotel is near the beach.

cards.definition: a road in a town or city
cards.context: I live on a quiet street.

cards.definition: a public area with grass and trees
cards.context: We walk in the park every Sunday.

cards.definition: a place where planes land and take off
cards.context: The airport is far from the city.

cards.definition: a place where people work at desks
cards.context: He goes to the office every day.

cards.definition: a place where food and goods are sold
cards.context: I buy fruit at the market.

cards.definition: a place where money is kept
cards.context: I need to go to the bank.

cards.definition: the ongoing passage of hours and minutes
the dark part of the day
the early part of the day
cards.context: I go jogging in the morning.

cards.definition: the time from noon to evening
cards.context: I have a class in the afternoon.

cards.definition: the time from late afternoon to night
cards.context: We eat dinner in the evening.
I work five days a week.

cards.definition: one of the twelve parts of a year
cards.context: January is the first month of the year.
This year I want to travel.
The film is two hours long.
I wake up early on weekdays.
Sorry, I am late for class.

cards.definition: the star that gives light and heat

cards.context: It is going to rain this afternoon.

cards.definition: frozen white flakes falling from the sky
cards.context: Children love playing in the snow.
It is very hot in summer.

cards.definition: a tall plant with a trunk and branches
cards.context: There is a big tree in the garden.

cards.definition: the colorful part of a plant
cards.context: She gave me a beautiful flower.

cards.definition: a living creature that is not a plant
cards.context: A dog is a popular animal.
My dog likes to play in the park.
The cat is sleeping on the sofa.

cards.definition: an animal with wings that can fly
cards.context: A bird is singing in the tree.

cards.definition: a large body of salt water
cards.context: We swim in the sea in summer.

cards.definition: a large stream of water flowing to the sea
cards.context: The river runs through the city.

cards.definition: a very high area of land
cards.context: We climbed a mountain last weekend.

cards.definition: to exist or have a state

cards.context: What do you do for a living?

cards.definition: to move from one place to another
cards.context: I go to school every day.

cards.definition: to put food in your mouth and swallow

cards.context: I drink a lot of water.
I sleep eight hours a night.

cards.definition: to look at and understand written words
to form letters or words on paper
cards.context: Can you write your name here?
I can see the mountains from here.

cards.definition: to direct your eyes at something
to have information in your mind

cards.context: I want a glass of water.
I need to buy some bread.
Take your umbrella, it might rain.
Can you give me that book?

cards.definition: to use your mind to form ideas
cards.context: I think this is a good idea.
Can I ask you a question?

cards.definition: to do a job or task
to do an activity for fun
cards.context: The children play in the park.

cards.definition: to move on foot at a normal speed
to rest on a chair or seat
to make something no longer closed

cards.context: Close the window, it is cold.

cards.definition: to not continue moving or doing
to get something by paying money
cards.context: I want to buy a new shirt.
I need to pay the bill.

cards.definition: to stay in one place until something happens
cards.context: Wait for me at the door.

cards.definition: to phone or shout to someone

cards.context: Put the book on the table.
I live in a small apartment.

cards.definition: to make an effort to do something
cards.context: Try this cake, it is delicious.

cards.definition: to know the meaning of something
cards.context: I do not understand this word.
My mother cooks dinner every day.

cards.definition: to make music with your voice
to experience an emotion or sensation

cards.context: I get up at six every morning.

cards.definition: to carry something to a place
to go away from a place

cards.context: Turn left at the traffic lights.

cards.definition: to do something with an object or tool
cards.context: I use a computer at work.

cards.definition: to look at something for a period of time
cards.context: We watch TV in the evening.
We are going to move to a new house.
I need to change my clothes.

cards.definition: to cause something to go to another place
cards.context: I will send you an email.
I will meet you at the café.
I need to finish my homework.
He carries his bag to school.

cards.definition: to have clothing on your body

cards.context: Stay here, I will be back soon.
They live in a big house.

cards.definition: having existed for a long time

cards.context: I am happy to see you.
The garden is beautiful in spring.

cards.definition: not long in length or height

cards.context: He is very tall for his age.

cards.definition: correct, or the opposite of left
not costing money, or not restricted
cards.context: This app is free to download.
She is too young to drive.
I am hungry, let us eat.
The shop is open until nine.
The library is closed on Sunday.

cards.definition: not costing a lot of money

cards.context: This area is safe at night.
He is sick and cannot come to work.
The library is a quiet place.
It is warm and sunny today.

cards.definition: the one you like the most

cards.context: The next bus arrives in ten minutes.
There are many books on the shelf.
I do not have much time.
I brush my teeth every morning.
All the students passed the test.
Do you have any other questions?
She is the only child in the family.
The cat is in the box.
The keys are on the table.

cards.definition: used to show a specific place or time

cards.context: I walk to school every day.

cards.definition: starting at a particular place or time
intended to belong to or benefit
in the space separating two things
cards.context: The bank is between the shop and the park.
The cat is under the bed.
The school is near my house.

cards.definition: used to connect words or ideas
cards.context: I have a cat and a dog.
I like coffee but not tea.
Do you want tea or coffee?
I am happy because it is Friday.
If it rains, we stay home.
I read when I have free time.

cards.definition: used to ask about a place
used to ask about a person
used to ask for a reason
things you wear on your body
cards.context: I need new clothes for winter.

cards.definition: a piece of clothing for the upper body
cards.context: He is wearing a white shirt.
She wears a hat in the sun.
She looks lovely in that dress.
Put on your coat, it is cold.

cards.definition: what a person or thing is called

cards.context: I learned a new word today.
I do not know the answer.
There is a problem with my phone.
What is that thing on the table?
This is a nice place to eat.
This is the way to the park.
This is the best part of the movie.
I have a lot of homework.

cards.definition: a type or category; also generous
cards.context: What kind of music do you like?

cards.definition: before now or earlier than expected

cards.context: I have enough money for lunch.
I was tired, so I went to bed.
I need to eat less sugar.
There is nothing in the fridge.
Someone is knocking on the door.
